verses.kjv: And I heard a great voice out of the temple saying to the seven angels, Go your ways, and pour out the vials of the wrath of God upon the earth.
verses.web: I heard a loud voice out of the temple, saying to the seven angels, “Go and pour out the seven bowls of the wrath of God on the earth!”
verses.ct: Then I heard a thundering voice from the temple say to the 7 angels, "Go and pour out the 7 bowls of God's wrath on the earth!"

verses.kjv: And the first went, and poured out his vial upon the earth; and there fell a noisome and grievous sore upon the men which had the mark of the beast, and upon them which worshipped his image.
verses.web: The first went, and poured out his bowl into the earth, and it became a harmful and evil sore on the people who had the mark of the beast, and who worshiped his image.
verses.ct: The first angel went and poured out his bowl on the earth. Ugly, painful sores broke out on everyone who bore the mark of the beast and worshiped his image.

verses.kjv: And the second angel poured out his vial upon the sea; and it became as the blood of a dead man: and every living soul died in the sea.
verses.web: The second angel poured out his bowl into the sea, and it became blood as of a dead man. Every living thing in the sea died.
verses.ct: The second angel poured out his bowl on the sea, and it turned to blood — thick like the blood of a dead man. Every living thing in the sea died.

verses.kjv: And the third angel poured out his vial upon the rivers and fountains of waters; and they became blood.
verses.web: The third poured out his bowl into the rivers and springs of water, and they became blood.
verses.ct: The third angel poured out his bowl on the rivers and springs, and they too turned to blood.

verses.kjv: And I heard the angel of the waters say, Thou art righteous, O Lord, which art, and wast, and shalt be, because thou hast judged thus.
verses.web: I heard the angel of the waters saying, “You are righteous, who are and who were, O Holy One, because you have judged these things.
verses.ct: Then I heard the angel who had authority over the waters say, "You are righteous, O LORD — you who are and who always were, the Holy One — because you have handed down this judgment.

verses.kjv: For they have shed the blood of saints and prophets, and thou hast given them blood to drink; for they are worthy.
verses.web: For they poured out the blood of saints and prophets, and you have given them blood to drink. They deserve this.”
verses.ct: They spilled the blood of your saints and prophets, so you have given them blood to drink. They deserve it."

verses.kjv: And I heard another out of the altar say, Even so, Lord God Almighty, true and righteous are thy judgments.
verses.web: I heard the altar saying, “Yes, Lord God, the Almighty, true and righteous are your judgments.”
verses.ct: And I heard a voice from the altar say, "Yes, Lord God, the Almighty — your judgments are true and righteous."

verses.kjv: And the fourth angel poured out his vial upon the sun; and power was given unto him to scorch men with fire.
verses.web: The fourth poured out his bowl on the sun, and it was given to him to scorch men with fire.
verses.ct: The fourth angel poured out his bowl on the sun, and it was given power to scorch people with fire.

verses.kjv: And men were scorched with great heat, and blasphemed the name of God, which hath power over these plagues: and they repented not to give him glory.
verses.web: People were scorched with great heat, and people blasphemed the name of God who has the power over these plagues. They didn’t repent and give him glory.
verses.ct: People were burned by the intense heat, and they cursed the name of God, who had authority over these plagues. But they refused to repent and give him glory.

verses.kjv: And the fifth angel poured out his vial upon the seat of the beast; and his kingdom was full of darkness; and they gnawed their tongues for pain,
verses.web: The fifth poured out his bowl on the throne of the beast, and his kingdom was darkened. They gnawed their tongues because of the pain,
verses.ct: The fifth angel poured out his bowl on the throne of the beast, and his kingdom was plunged into darkness. People gnawed their tongues in agony,

verses.kjv: And blasphemed the God of heaven because of their pains and their sores, and repented not of their deeds.
verses.web: and they blasphemed the God of heaven because of their pains and their sores. They didn’t repent of their works.
verses.ct: and they cursed the God of heaven because of their pain and their sores. Still, they refused to repent of what they had done.

verses.kjv: And the sixth angel poured out his vial upon the great river Euphrates; and the water thereof was dried up, that the way of the kings of the east might be prepared.
verses.web: The sixth poured out his bowl on the great river, the Euphrates. Its water was dried up, that the way might be prepared for the kings that come from the sunrise.
verses.ct: The sixth angel poured out his bowl on the great river Euphrates, and its water dried up completely, clearing a path for the kings from the east.

verses.kjv: And I saw three unclean spirits like frogs come out of the mouth of the dragon, and out of the mouth of the beast, and out of the mouth of the false prophet.
verses.web: I saw coming out of the mouth of the dragon, and out of the mouth of the beast, and out of the mouth of the false prophet, three unclean spirits, something like frogs;
verses.ct: Then I saw 3 unclean spirits that looked like frogs come out of the mouth of the dragon, out of the mouth of the beast, and out of the mouth of the false prophet.

verses.kjv: For they are the spirits of devils, working miracles, which go forth unto the kings of the earth and of the whole world, to gather them to the battle of that great day of God Almighty.
verses.web: for they are spirits of demons, performing signs; which go out to the kings of the whole inhabited earth, to gather them together for the war of that great day of God, the Almighty.
verses.ct: These were demonic spirits performing miraculous signs. They went out to the kings of the entire world to rally them for battle on the great day of God, the Almighty.

verses.kjv: Behold, I come as a thief. Blessed is he that watcheth, and keepeth his garments, lest he walk naked, and they see his shame.
verses.web: “Behold, I come like a thief. Blessed is he who watches, and keeps his clothes, so that he doesn’t walk naked, and they see his shame.”
verses.ct: "Pay attention — I am coming like a thief! Blessed is the one who stays alert and keeps his clothes ready, so he won't be caught walking naked and exposed to shame."

verses.kjv: And he gathered them together into a place called in the Hebrew tongue Armageddon.
verses.web: He gathered them together into the place which is called in Hebrew, “Megiddo”.
verses.ct: The spirits gathered the kings together at the place called in Hebrew, Armageddon.

verses.kjv: And the seventh angel poured out his vial into the air; and there came a great voice out of the temple of heaven, from the throne, saying, It is done.
verses.web: The seventh poured out his bowl into the air. A loud voice came out of the temple of heaven, from the throne, saying, “It is done!”
verses.ct: The seventh angel poured out his bowl into the air, and a booming voice came from the throne in the temple of heaven, declaring, "It is done!"

verses.kjv: And there were voices, and thunders, and lightnings; and there was a great earthquake, such as was not since men were upon the earth, so mighty an earthquake, and so great.
verses.web: There were lightnings, sounds, and thunders; and there was a great earthquake, such as has not happened since there were men on the earth, so great an earthquake, and so mighty.
verses.ct: Then came flashes of lightning, rumbling thunder, and a massive earthquake — the worst earthquake since people have existed on the earth, unmatched in its power and destruction.

verses.kjv: And the great city was divided into three parts, and the cities of the nations fell: and great Babylon came in remembrance before God, to give unto her the cup of the wine of the fierceness of his wrath.
verses.web: The great city was divided into three parts, and the cities of the nations fell. Babylon the great was remembered in the sight of God, to give to her the cup of the wine of the fierceness of his wrath.
verses.ct: The great city split into 3 parts, and the cities of every nation collapsed. God remembered Babylon the great, and he made her drink the cup filled with the wine of his fierce wrath.

verses.kjv: And every island fled away, and the mountains were not found.
verses.web: Every island fled away, and the mountains were not found.
verses.ct: Every island vanished, and the mountains could no longer be found.

verses.kjv: And there fell upon men a great hail out of heaven, every stone about the weight of a talent: and men blasphemed God because of the plague of the hail; for the plague thereof was exceeding great.
verses.web: Great hailstones, about the weight of a talent, came down out of the sky on people. People blasphemed God because of the plague of the hail, for this plague is exceedingly severe.
verses.ct: Enormous hailstones, each weighing about a talent, fell from the sky onto people. They cursed God because of the plague of hail, for the devastation was beyond anything they had ever seen.
